summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter record for Jeffrey Epstein dated July 24, 2019, documenting a follow-up visit after an apparent neck injury. Epstein insinuates his cellmate was involved in the injury but refuses to discuss details. The record notes erythema and abrasions on his neck.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate receiving medical evaluation for a neck injury at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM). He insinuates his cellmate caused the injury but refuses to elaborate.

connections.description: Epstein insinuates to the medical provider that his cellmate 'had to do with what happened to me' regarding his neck injuries.

events.title: Epstein's Medical Follow-up for Neck Injury
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is seen for a follow-up medical encounter at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He has erythema and abrasions on his neck and insinuates his cellmate was involved but refuses to provide details.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was seen for a medical follow-up on July 24, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM).
Epstein had visible erythema and abrasions on his neck but did not complain of pain or respiratory distress.
Epstein told the medical provider, 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me,' but refused to elaborate or answer questions.
The medical assessment was 'Injury, unspecified' (code T1490).
This medical encounter occurred approximately two weeks before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
